content.description: Follow the leftmost line of bolts to the dihedral, then climb the dihedral until you run out of rope.  Set a belay in the alcove.  Continue right, then up to the summit and descent trail.
content.protection: Draws, set of cams, set of nuts

content.description: From the base of Sunday Slab, Directissima climbs 100' past three bolts to a two-bolt anchor at mid-way.  Rappel (you may have to leave a biner if its gone), or climb past two more bolts, then over a roof protected by a cam to belay at the top of the slab.  Great route.
content.protection: a half dozen draws and a light rack for the last belay.

content.description: This is the obvious thin crack in the center of the slab.  The seam takes gear in places, and does protect adequately.  i think I got 5 pieces plus the bolt.  The crux comes at the overlaps near the top, but you can get a good nut in right below.  Once you clip the bolt, you can traverse right to anchors, and belay/rappel.
content.protection: rack to 1.5" plus a draws for one bolt and the anchors.
